segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely absorbed in drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is so focused; she doesn’t even notice the water spilling over the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost as if she’s in her own little world, away from the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That puddle is growing, and it makes me feel a little uneasy just watching it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for her to realize the mess she’s standing in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is on that stool, trying to reach for cookies like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but be surprised by how he doesn’t seem to care that the stool could tip any second.
segments.speaker: PAR
